content: Seulki Lee (이슬기) - UNIST Computer Science (AI Graduate School)Search this siteEmbedded FilesSkip to main contentSkip to navigationSEULKI LEE (이슬기)Associate ProfessorComputer Science and Engineering (CSE)Artificial Intelligence Graduate School (AIGS)Ulsan National Institute of Science and Technology (UNIST)LinksGoogle ScholarCVLinkedInORCIDDBLPGitHubContactEmail: seulki.lee at unist.ac.krEmbedded Artificial Intelligence (Embedded AI) Lab, UNIST307-2, #106 3rd Engineering Building, UNIST-gil 50, Ulsan, KoreaAnnouncementOur research group, Embedded AI Lab (EAI, Embedded Artificial Intelligence Lab), is looking for new members (MS/PhD/Intern/PostDoc) who are interested in systems and AI research in 2026. Please visit our lab homepage for more information.AboutSeulki Lee is an associate professor at the Department of Computer Science and Engineering (CSE) and Artificial Intelligence Graduate School (AIGS) at UNIST (Ulsan National Institute of Science and Technology), where he leads EAI Lab (Embedded Artificial Intelligence Lab). He earned his Ph.D. in Computer Science at the Department of Computer Science, the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill (UNC), advised by Dr. Shahriar Nirjon. His research aims to make resource-constrained real-time and embedded sensing systems capable of learning, adapting, and evolving, which facilitates Embedded Artificial Intelligence (Embedded AI). Prior to starting his Ph.D., he designed sensor system architecture and intelligent sensing algorithms for smartphones at Samsung Electronics. He spent two summers as a research intern at Nokia Bell Labs and Mercedes-Benz Research & Development North America, where he researched machine learning and future transportation systems.Research InterestsEmbedded Artificial Intelligence (Embedded AI)On-device machine learning on embedded/mobile/IoT devicesEmbedded Computer Vision, Embedded NLP, Embedded Reinforcement LearningEfficient model (deep learning) inference, training, and adaptationCollaborative and Collective Learning SystemsPervasive- and always-learning on connected systemsScalable and autonomous intelligence on networked
